III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that on 9/1/24, Youth A was choked by an unidentified
staff member.
Investigation I left a voicemail to Complainant on 9/4/24. I have not received a
return call.
I spoke to Administrator on 9/4/24. Allegations were discussed
and no new information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed on 9/12/24 at the facility. Youth A
reported he was pulled down on the floor by an unknown staff
member and was choked by Staff 3. Youth A reported Staff 3 had
his forearm on his neck while he was on the floor. Youth A
reported he doesn’t remember being restrained and doesn’t
remember what his behaviors were. Youth A would not provide
any more details.
Staff 1 reported on 9/1/24, Youth A had turned around his day
and was doing well. Because of this, they allowed him to play
video games. Staff 1 reported Youth A does not do well
transitioning from this activity. In order to be proactive, Staff 1
made sure he was aware of the time frame he could play and
gave him time updates so that Youth A would know when his time
would be up. Once Youth A’s time was up, he escalated and
started throwing items around. The other youth in the room
became upset so they had redirected Youth A out into the hallway.
Youth A went into the hallway and then attempted to walk outside.
He then went back inside into his bedroom. Staff 2 was in the
bedroom, removing items that would cause him to be distracted.
Staff 1 reported Youth A grabbed Staff 2’s long hair and pulled her
to the ground. Both Staff 2 and Youth A were on the ground. Staff
2

1 reported he along with Staff 3, pried open his fingers so Staff 2
could get free. Once they did this, they were already on the floor,
so they (Staff 1 and Staff 3) engaged in the supine control
position. Staff 2 removed herself from the bedroom. Staff 1
reported they maintained this hold until Youth A was safe again.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was crying and coughing afterwards and
did say he was “throwing up blood.” Staff 1 reported Youth A was
not throwing up blood but spitting. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
not harmed, was not chocked, nor had any injuries. Staff 1
reported since it was bedtime, Youth A went to bed after his
behavior was discussed.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was playing video games in the common
area before bedtime. Staff 2 reported Youth A was reminded
throughout his playing how much time he had left with the
videogame. When it was time to give back the game, Youth A did
not want to and became upset. Youth A went into the hallway and
then went outside. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 went outside after
Youth A and she went into his bedroom to remove possible safety
items. Youth A then came into the room and pulled her hair and
brought both of them to the floor. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and Staff
3 came in and loosened her hair from Youth A’s hands. Staff 2
was not sure how they did this due to her lack of ability to see, but
reported after she was released, she left the room because she
knew she was upset. When Staff 2 came back into the room, the
restraint was over, and Youth A was being debriefed. Staff 2
reported Youth A was sitting on his bed and Staff 1 and Staff 3
were debriefing him. Youth A never reported he was hurt and did
not state anyone had choked him.
Staff 3 reported he was called to assist with a situation with Youth
A. Youth A was upset and was pacing in the lobby and then went
outside. Youth A came back inside and into his bedroom. As Staff
3 was turning off the exit alarm, he heard screaming. Staff 3
reported he went into the bedroom and Youth A had both his
hands pulling and grabbing Staff 2’s hair. Staff 3 reported he and
Staff 1 pried Youth A’s fingers from Staff 2’s hair. Once released
from Youth A’s hold, Staff 2 left the room. Both Staff 2 and Youth
A were already on the ground due to Youth A pulling her hair,
causing her to go to the ground so Staff 3 reported they placed
him in a supine control; lasting seven minutes. Staff 3 reported it
was a textbook supine due to them already on the ground. Staff 3
reported no one choked Youth A and Youth A did not spit up
blood. Youth A never complained about being hurt after the
restraint. Staff 3 reported he was not spitting up blood.
3

Video Reviewed:
Video was observed from 7:48pm-8:10pm on 9/1/24. The hallway
and lobby area are the only visible areas. The restraint occurred in
the bedroom. The interviews of Staff 1, Staff, 2, and Staff 3 are all
consistent with the video footage in the lobby and hallway.
Documents:
• Personnel files: all staff were up to date on training and
clearances. None of the Staff had disciplinary action.
• Incident report dated 9/1/24 is consistent with staff
interviews. Youth A was not injured nor needed follow up
medical.
• The Behavior Management Policy which includes the CPI
manual was reviewed. The agency followed their CPI
manual, which shows the appropriate techniques, including
restraint, to deescalate a youth in outburst.
• The Behavior Management Policy was reviewed. The
policy confirms that physical punishment is not a tool for
de-escalation.
Analysis The agency is complaint with this rule. Staff completed a CPI
Supine restraint. There is no evidence to validate the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
